author: MateoConLechuga

title: Geometry Dash CE
description:
If you want to play other levels than the basic ones (since there are only 8) do not hesitate to take a look at the Games Levels Geometry Dash category !
In addition, you can create your own level! I refer you to the project topic if you want to do it on a computer or to the integrated level editor topic if you want to do it directly on your calculator!

NEW:
- Creation of the editing mode accessible from the main menu by pressing [Alpha] to edit and [+] to create!
- Improvement of the hitbox
- Correction of minor bugs
- ...

Geometry Dash (The Impossible Game) ported to TI-83 Premium CE and TI-84+CE! Play 8 different levels (Stereo Madness/Back On Track/Polargeist/Dry Out/Base After Base/Can't Let Go/Jumper/Time Machine) and create them using the integrated level editor or the online converter! (see the project and editor presentation topics below)

KEYS:
***** In the menu:
- MODE/DEL/CANCEL: quit
- : choose a level
- ENTER/2NDE: launch the game for the selected level
- ALPHA: Edit the selected level
- +: Create a level
***** In the game:
- 2NDE: Jump
- DEL: Return to the main menu
- CANCEL: Quit the game instantly
- ENTER: Open the pause menu (minimalist)

For the level editor keys, read the README.md file or see the shortcut_gdedit.png image in the archive!

This program is licensed under the Creative Commons BY-NC-SA 4.0 license.

Feel free to check out the project progress topic!
https://tiplanet.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=12&t=19211
And here is the topic for the presentation of the integrated level editor!
https://tiplanet.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=12&t=23601

The project is also on Github: https://github.com/MathisLav/GeometryDashCE
author: Epharius , Anonymous0

title: FlappyBird
description:
FlappyBird for TI-83 Premium CE / TI-84 Plus CE.

Requires having the Libs C on his calculator
author: Rico

title: CEleste
description:
(A video tutorial for the following steps is also available
here)

Transfer CELESTE.8xp
and the C Libraries to the calculator using TI Connect CE
or TiLP. Then, select prgmCELESTE from the program menu and press enter.
If this results in an error, arTIfiCE is
required for your OS version.

Use the arrow keys to move, 2nd to jump and alpha to dash. To exit the game, press
the clear key to save your progress, or del to exit without saving.

A practice mode for speedrunning can be accessed by pressing the graph key from
the title screen. In this mode, the time for the current room is displayed in white, and
your best time for the room (in frames) is displayed in yellow. After completing a room,
you will restart on the same level. To move to the previous level, press y=; to move to
the next, press graph. You can also press window to toggle the HUD, and zoom to toggle
gemskip mode.
author: commandblockguy

title: RanGen CE
description:
This is my second shared attempt at RanGen, or random generation. I call it that because it sounds cooler and is shorter. No need to credit me for the name—I just feel there should be a simplified name for it. I got the idea of making one of these from @surlo_gamez wasteland platformer. I recovered the first version for y'all if you'd like to play it. Here's the link: https://scratch.mit.edu/projects/552030316/
For an extended version of the game, go to https://github.com/ashbit06/RanGen and download the RanGen.zip file. There will be an HTML file that you can open to play the game. Some features include full gamepad support.

title: Tetric A (Tetris-like) (Version CE)
description:
Written in assembly and a close port of my Tetrizm game for the Casio Prizm, Tetric A is a fast, fun take on the classic arcade game, Tetris. Enjoy five unique modes: Marathon, High Speed, Cascade, Touchdown, and Sadistic. Runs on color-screen TI-84 Plus CE. Try this addicting arcade-style game today!

Via http://ticalc.org/archives/files/fileinfo/465/46530.html
Official topic: https://cemetech.net/news.php?id=755
author: Kerm, Martian

title: Cesium
description:
Very first shell for CE calculators :)

Features:
Running ASM, C, and Basic programs directly, (Un) Archiving, deleting, renaming, and hiding programs
Quick access to a program by typing its first letter (≈ catalog) Ability to block the [ON] key when running
Basic programs
Support for relocatable shared C and ASM libraries Customizable icons for all file types
___________________________________

Source code: https://github.com/MateoConLechuga/Cesium

title: Blocks CE
description: A Minecraft-esque game for the TI 84 CE calculator. In it you can generate natural-looking worlds, place up to 24 different kinds of blocks, keep up to 5 saves, and enjoy real-time shadow effects, transparent water, and a 10 FPS framerate!
author: TheScienceElf

title: Plane Jump
description:
Roll your ball on a plane with the arrow keys. Be careful, various holes or narrowings are waiting for you. The [2nd] key will also allow you to jump your ball.

----------

Roll forward as a barely-controllable ball along a fast and smoothly-rendered 3D road while avoiding all the pitfalls by jumping or rolling out of the way. Keep rolling as long as possible to achieve the highest score
author: Iambian

title: Mario Kart CE
description:
----------

This is an extremely early and potentially buggy test version of
Mario Kart CE (or is it Oiram Trak CE?).

Simply copy MKARTCE.8XP to your calculator with your favourite
flavour of linking software and run it with your prefered method
for running native ASM programs (homescreen, Asm(, shell etc).

Keys:
2nd - Accelerate
Down - Stop
Left - Turn left
Right - Turn right
alpha - Shoot green shell (unlimited but it's the only item)
enter - Change character (8 different chars)

The demo features you vs 5 AI racers. The AI only drive around
the track, they don't pick up or use any items. You have access
to unlimited green shells as a test item - note that they break
when they hit another racer, a wall or object (they dont yet
bounce around).

There is only 1 track and despite there being a lap counter up
the top left, there is no end to the race (it will probably
overflow if you're really keen).

As mentioned this is pre pre-alpha and should be considered
unstable and potentially dangerous. Whilst it doesn't mess with
anything too serious, it does unlock SHA256 mem and rearrange
a lot of memory when running.

The graphics are blocky in places because this runs in half-res
(simulated) and is a calculator game ... so sacrifices needed
to be made. It should run at a playable frame rate however.

Collisions, item use, lap tracking and lots of other things are
only preliminary at this stage, so there are bound to be lots
of glitches and stuff. I'd appreciate if you find anything like
this that you let me know.

It is TEST ONLY. Feel free to check it out but please do not
distribute this in the wild as it could have serious bugs that
I am not aware of.

Post thoughts, criticism and findings in the thread on Cemetech.

Enjoy!

tr1p1ea
author: tr1p1ea

title: Banchor: Legend of the Hellspawn
description:
Banchor is a Zelda-type RPG for TI-83 Premium CE. Embody Rex the hero, in his gesture to rescue Princess Saphir and undo Banchor, the demon of hell. Improve your weapons, defense and endurance, and help yourself with the many NPCs encountered...

----------

Banchor is a huge Zelda-type RPG for the TI-84+CE! You take control of the heroic Rex, as he ventures on a mammoth quest to rescue the kidnapped Princess Sapphira and defeat the evil demon from Hell, Banchor. Upgrade your weapons and defenses, increase your level of life and meet many people along that way that will help you in your quest! Pub / Ads News articles referring to this archive

author: Snowberry

title: Androides
description:
Type: Lode Runner

Author: William Hennebois

Publisher: Infogrames

Release: 1985

Platforms: Thomson (MO5, TO7/70)

Adaptation: Xavier Andréani

Platforms: TI-83 Premium CE, TI-84 Plus CE

ANDROIDS (from the Greek ANDROS: man, and EIDOS: aspect): what has HUMAN FORM!

Scientists have given these robots, in addition to the power to perform common tasks, to kill everything that looks like a human. Is it a coincidence? Is it planned? You are their prey.

A fantastic 100% machine language action game. Suspense, crazy race, how to escape these dangerous robots while collecting as many gifts as possible!

-------------

License: GPL

-------------

Transfer the 2 ANDROID and ANDRODAT files to your calculator!
author: Xavier, Andréani, William, Hennebois, Adriweb

title: Race2D
description:
A 2d racing game, where you get thrown in a random vehicle and have to drive as far as possible without colliding to often.
There are highscores and the player vehicle gets faster over time.

When run in CEmu, the framerate gets increased.

Source: https://www.cemetech.net/downloads/files/1922/x1922
author: marcrob01
